## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
**User:**
I'm really interested in learning more about how PBaaS chains operate within the Verus network. Can you explain that to me?

**AI Assistant:**
All PBaaS chains run from the same daemon, and projects can choose to join the worldwide Verus community in improving the daemon. This allows them to start with a complete, multi-currency, ID-capable blockchain with DeFi capabilities that is merge-mineable and stakeable with other blockchains in the Verus network. This setup provides a lot of flexibility and power to projects building on Verus.

**User:**
That's really interesting. I've also been wondering about DeFi liquidity pools and fractional currency baskets in Verus. What's the purpose of those?

**AI Assistant:**
DeFi liquidity pools and fractional currency baskets enable ID owners to define Verus DeFi fractional basket currencies with one or more asset currencies backing the liquidity pool at a fractional percentage. This ensures that all currency conversions that use a particular liquidity pool and are mined into one block are solved and priced simultaneously, addressing issues like miner extracted value (MEV) and front-running, and providing fee-based DeFi integrated incentives to miners and stakers. It's a powerful tool for building decentralized finance applications on Verus.

**User:**
Another thing I've been curious about is how simultaneous blockchain and blockchain liquidity pool launches work in Verus. Can you walk me through that?

**AI Assistant:**
When launching a new blockchain, a fully decentralized or centralized "bridge" converter liquidity pool can be launched simultaneously as part of defining the new blockchain. Bridge converter currencies have the same flexibility as other fractional 100% asset-backed or partially asset-backed currencies, but are bound to the launch of the new blockchain and run on the new blockchain. This allows for a smooth and integrated launch of new blockchains and liquidity pools, making it easier to build and deploy new decentralized applications on Verus.
How do PBaaS chains operate within the Verus network?

All PBaaS chains run from the same daemon, and projects can choose to join the worldwide Verus community in improving the daemon. This allows them to start with a complete, multi-currency, ID-capable blockchain with DeFi capabilities that is merge-mineable and stakeable with other blockchains in the Verus network.

nted on non-Verus systems.
## Multi-currency, user created, decentralized tokens and merge-mineable, interoperable blockchains without programming
- Enables any user with an ID to create their own token currency or even full fledged, multi-currency, ID-issuing 50% POW/50% POS, 51% hash attack resistant blockchain that can send and receive from the Verus chain which launched it. All PBaaS chains run from the same daemon, and projects may choose to join the worldwide Verus community in improving the daemon. In doing so, they will start with a complete, multi-currency, ID-capable blockchain with DeFi capabilities that is merge-mineable and stakeable with other blockchains in the Verus network.
## Consensus integrated DeFi liquidity pools and fractional currency baskets
- Any ID owner may define Verus DeFi fractional basket currencies with one or more asset currencies backing the liquidity pool at a fractional percentage ranging from 5% to 100% backing. The Verus DeFi protocol ensures that all currency conversions that use a particular liquidity pool and are mined into one block are solved and priced simultaneously, addressing the problems of miner extracted value (MEV) and front-running, while providing fee-based DeFi integrated incentives to miners and stakers, ensuring smooth consensus operation and fee conversion capabilities by integrating DeFi liquidity pools directly into the consensus and cross-chain bridge protocols.
## Simultaneous blockchain and blockchain liquidity pool launches
- Launch of a world class, worldwide, merge-mineable blockchain along with a fully decentralized or centralized “bridge” converter liquidity pool as part of defining a new blockchain. Bridge converter currencies have the same flexibility as other fractional 100% asset backed or partially asset backed currencies, but is bound to the launch of the new blockchain, runs on the new blockcha
